property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.schedule-asynchronously.enable
property.description: Enable async scheduling of capacity scheduler.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.schedule-asynchronously.maximum-threads
property.description: Number of threads which will be used to do scheduling (expert)

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.schedule-asynchronously.scheduling-interval-ms
property.description: Maximum wait time between scheduling batches (expert)

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.maximum-applications
property.description: Maximum number of applications that can be pending and running.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.maximum-am-resource-percent
property.description: Maximum percent of resources in the cluster which can be used to run application masters i.e. controls number of concurrent running applications.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.queues
property.description: The queues at the this level (root is the root queue).

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.capacity
property.description: The total capacity as a percentage out of 100 for this queue. If it has child queues then this includes their capacity as well. The child queues capacity should add up to their parent queue's capacity or less.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.user-limit-factor
property.description: Default queue user limit a percentage from 0.0 to 1.0.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.maximum-capacity
property.description: The maximum capacity of the default queue.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.state
property.description: The state of the default queue. State can be one of RUNNING or STOPPED.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.acl_submit_applications
property.description: The ACL of who can submit jobs to the default queue.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.default.acl_administer_jobs
property.description: The ACL of who can administer jobs on the default queue.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.acl_submit_applications
property.description: The ACL of who can submit jobs to the root queue.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.root.acl_administer_queue
property.description: The ACL for who can administer this queue i.e. change sub-queue allocations.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.node-locality-delay
property.description: Number of missed scheduling opportunities after which the CapacityScheduler attempts to schedule rack-local containers. Typically this should be set to number of nodes in the cluster, By default is setting approximately number of nodes in one rack which is 40.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.default.minimum-user-limit-percent
property.description: Default minimum queue resource limit depends on the number of users who have submitted applications.

property.name: yarn.scheduler.capacity.resource-calculator
property.description: The ResourceCalculator implementation to be used to compare Resources in the scheduler. The default i.e. org.apache.hadoop.yarn.util.resource.DefaultResourseCalculator only uses Memory while DominantResourceCalculator uses Dominant-resource to compare multi-dimensional resources such as Memory, CPU etc. A Java ResourceCalculator class name is expected.

property.name: capacity-scheduler
property.description: Enter key=value (one per line) for all properties of capacity-scheduler.xml
